intro: Arctotis oocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its flowers are usually bright yellow with a dark center, and they bloom from late winter to early spring. Arctotis oocephala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
